name: The Secret Ingredient (Za'atar): Za'atar Fried Chicken
description: Week two in my unorthodox treatment of za'atar continues with this recipe for za'atar-seasoned fried chicken. It's a simple preparation: dip in buttermilk, roll in flour, fry in a cast iron pan. But the flour is doctored with a good dose of za'atar, a blend of salt and sumac and sesame: only thyme breaks up the consonance of the mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chicken in a large baggie with the buttermilk, and place in the fridge for 1 to 2 hours.
Meanwhile, fill a cast iron frying pan halfway with vegetable oil, and heat to 325 degrees F.
Fry the drumettes 5 minutes on each side (10 minutes total). Remove to a cooling rack to drain. Serve immediately.
